Name: epidermolysis bullosa simplex Dowling-Meara type
Definition: An epidermolysis bullosa simplex characterized by generalized non-scarring skin blistering that often occurs in clusters

Name: epidermolysis bullosa simplex Ogna type
Definition: An epidermolysis bullosa simplex characterized by skin blisters originating in the deepest areas of the basal cell cytoplasm just above the hemidesmosomes

Name: epidermolysis bullosa simplex localized type
Definition: An epidermolysis bullosa simplex that is characterized by skin blistering that begins anytime between childhood and adulthood and is usually limited to the hands and feet.

Name: epidermolysis bullosa simplex generalized type
Definition: An epidermolysis bullosa simplex that is characterized by widespread blisters that appear at birth or in early infancy.

Name: epidermolysis bullosa simplex with mottled pigmentation
Definition: An epidermolysis bullosa simplex characterized by generalized blistering with mottled hyper- and hypopigmentation of the skin that has_material_basis_in heterozygous mutation in KRT5 on chromosome 12q13.13.
Synonym: speckled hyperpigmentation with punctate palmoplantar keratoses and childhood blistering
